thread.title: Canada says gravely concerned by Myanmar's jailing of journalists

title: Canada says gravely concerned by Myanmar's jailing of journalists
text: February 27, 2018 / 1:20 PM / Updated 40 minutes ago Canada says gravely concerned by Myanmar's jailing of journalists Reuters Staff 1 Min Read GENEVA (Reuters) - Canada is gravely concerned by the imprisonment of two Reuters journalists in Myanmar, Foreign Minister Chrystia Freeland told the U.N. Human Rights Council on Tuesday, adding that ethnic cleansing had taken place in Myanmar’s Rakhine state. “For true democracy to flourish, fundamental freedoms such as freedom of the press must be respected. That is why Canada is gravely concerned by the imprisonment of two Reuters journalists who dared to report on the crimes in Rakhine state,” she said. Reporting by Tom Miles; Editing by Alex Richardson
